I have worked with some great&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; graphic&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;designers in my time, and the kind input the good ones want are&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; typically&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;related around your thoughts/feelings around the product rather than&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; which&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;particular animal you prefer, which is a bit of a secondary kind of&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; input&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;along with all different kinds of other constraints/ideas (the boss&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;prefers&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;blue).&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;When I first encountered maven I had come to the realization that all&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; my&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;ant projects were basically the same, and that there was no reason for&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;customizing&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;what was basically a standard process. So maven gives me associations&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; to a&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;mass-production line at a factory, rather than a tailor making&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; individual&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;processes. Furthermore, the lifecycle amplifies the idea of a&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;conveyor-belt&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;mass-production line; all parts move through the same conveyor belt&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;process, stopping at&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;individual stages to get work done. I would almost be willing to think&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; of&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;a&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;waterfall (Uh-oh...)&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;So it would appear to me that I'm not thinking of an animal at all !&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;Kristian&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;2014/1/9 Mark H. Wood &lt;mwood@iupui.edu&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; On Thu, Jan 09, 2014 at 09:32:54AM -0600, Curtis Rueden wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt; All of the logos are OK, but none of them really symbolize&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; anything in&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt; particular about Maven. I was associating with the name "Maven", looking for&#010;a&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; symbol of in-depth understanding of a specialized field.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/maven&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; So, what does Maven do? That looks really nice (though I do have problems with any North&#010;American Indian references).&#010;&#010;cheers&#010;TimP&#010;&#010;On 14 January 2014 12:08, Stephen Connolly&#010;&lt;stephen.alan.connolly@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt; Putting maven-20 in context, you get:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; http://people.apache.org/~stephenc/maven-logo-contest/maven-20-in-context.png&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; On 14 January 2014 10:37, Stephen Connolly&#010;&gt; &lt;stephen.alan.connolly@gmail.com&gt;wrote:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; My wife had a suggestion... why not make the M in maven out of two tee&#010;&gt;&gt; pees... linking in with the Apache theme...&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; So I present&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; maven-19:&#010;&gt;&gt; https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/download/attachments/38569278/maven-19.png?version=1&amp;modificationDate=1389695638903&amp;api=v2&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; and finding a use for the feather&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; maven-20:&#010;&gt;&gt; https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/download/attachments/38569278/maven-20.png?version=1&amp;modificationDate=1389695654233&amp;api=v2&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; On 14 January 2014 10:35, Stephen Connolly &lt;&#010;&gt;&gt; stephen.alan.connolly@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; As a homage to Roy's wife, may I present&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; maven-18:&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/download/attachments/38569278/maven-18.png?version=1&amp;modificationDate=1389695623134&amp;api=v2&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; On 13 January 2014 15:36, Lyons, Roy &lt;Roy.Lyons@cmegroup.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; I asked my wife on the drive to the train today what animal she thinks&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; fits Maven.  Her response made me chuckle.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Without hesitation, she said "Honey Badger"&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; When I asked why, she said that Honey Badgers are part of nature and&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; generally do their thing nicely -- but if you piss it off, things will&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; get&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; really really bad...  She said she had the same experience with Maven.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;  It&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; works nicely, but if you try to do something really non-standard, you&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; will&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; feel its wrath :)&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Heh.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Anyhow, I thought it was funny enough to share - not really a serious&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; consideration to make a Honey Badger our mascot.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; On 1/10/14 1:20 AM, "Kristian Rosenvold" &lt;kristian.rosenvold@gmail.com&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;I think the association-work around what maven /is/ is a great way to&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;approach a logo contest elsewhere. I have worked with some great graphic&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;designers in my time, and the kind input the good ones want are&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; typically&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;related around your thoughts/feelings around the product rather than&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; which&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;particular animal you prefer, which is a bit of a secondary kind of&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; input&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;along with all different kinds of other constraints/ideas (the boss&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;prefers&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;blue).&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;When I first encountered maven I had come to the realization that all&#010;my&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;ant projects were basically the same, and that there was no reason for&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;customizing&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;what was basically a standard process. So maven gives me associations&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; to a&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;mass-production line at a factory, rather than a tailor making&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; individual&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;processes. Furthermore, the lifecycle amplifies the idea of a&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;conveyor-belt&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;mass-production line; all parts move through the same conveyor belt&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;process, stopping at&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;individual stages to get work done. I would almost be willing to think&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; of&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;a&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;waterfall (Uh-oh...)&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;So it would appear to me that I'm not thinking of an animal at all !&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;Kristian&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;2014/1/9 Mark H. Wood &lt;mwood@iupui.edu&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; On Thu, Jan 09, 2014 at 09:32:54AM -0600, Curtis Rueden wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt; All of the logos are OK, but none of them really symbolize&#010;anything&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; in&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt; particular about Maven. IMO the best logos encapsulate the&#010;purpose&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; of&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;the&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt; project somehow, either overtly, covertly or both.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; Good point.  I was associating with the name "Maven", looking for&#010;a&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; symbol of in-depth understanding of a specialized field.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/maven&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; So, what does Maven do?  It passes unique source and object code&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; inputs through a standardized process, guided by an expression of&#010;the&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; relationships among those inputs, to assemble a well-specified&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; configuration of runnable code.  What does that look like?&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; --&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; Mark H. Wood, Lead System Programmer   mwood@IUPUI.Edu&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; Machines should not be friendly.  Machines should be obedient.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; ---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;-- &#010;Tim Pizey&#010;http://pizey.net/~timp&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

We are "Apache Maven" so there is always going to be that temptation to&#010;abuse the "Apache" link...&#010;&#010;I would like to hear more about your objections.&#010;&#010;Keep in mind that ultimately it will come down to a vote...&#010;&#010;I'm thinking we have two rounds of voting... the first round to select the&#010;top 3 and the second round to select the winner...&#010;&#010;WIth the above scheme I would plan on having a healthy discussion of the&#010;top 3 candidates in case any are deemed inappropriate, i.e. the PMC will&#010;reserve the right to veto any that it deems inappropriate, substituting&#010;with the next most popular.&#010;&#010;Then the winner will be an open vote from the 3 finalists...&#010;&#010;Or at least that is my plan&#010;&#010;So far we have about 8 ideas...&#010;&#010;* The moose with the internet in his hand&#010;&#010;* The owl&#010;&#010;* The assembly line&#010;&#010;* The honey badger&#010;&#010;* The two yurts in a native american style&#010;&#010;* The twin peaks&#010;&#010;* The fedora as an M (likely too close to redhat... so not counting for now)&#010;&#010;* A simple lettering with a monochrome feather&#010;&#010;* A stylized lettering with the feather as a y&#010;&#010;If we get to about 15-20 ideas and/or there seems to be a stop to the flow&#010;of new ideas, then I will probably call the first round of voting...&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;On 14 January 2014 12:19, Tim Pizey &lt;timp@paneris.org&gt; So maven gives me associations&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; to a&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;mass-production line at a factory, rather than a tailor making&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; individual&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;processes. &gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt; On 14 January 2014 10:35, Stephen Connolly &lt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt; stephen.alan.connolly@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; On 13 January 2014 15:36, Lyons, Roy &lt;Roy.Lyons@cmegroup.com&gt;&#010;wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; I asked my wife on the drive to the train today what animal she&#010;&gt; thinks&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; fits Maven.  Her response made me chuckle.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Without hesitation, she said "Honey Badger"&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; When I asked why, she said that Honey Badgers are part of nature&#010;and&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; generally do their thing nicely -- but if you piss it off, things&#010;&gt; will&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; get&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; really really bad...  She said she had the same experience with&#010;&gt; Maven.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;  It&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; works nicely, but if you try to do something really non-standard,&#010;&gt; you&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; will&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; feel its wrath :)&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Heh.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Anyhow, I thought it was funny enough to share - not really a&#010;&gt; serious&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; consideration to make a Honey Badger our mascot.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; On 1/10/14 1:20 AM, "Kristian Rosenvold" &lt;&#010;&gt; &gt; kristian.rosenvold@gmail.com&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;I think the association-work around what maven /is/ is a great&#010;way&#010;&gt; to&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;approach a logo contest elsewhere. I have worked with some&#010;great&#010;&gt; &gt; graphic&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;designers in my time, and the kind input the good ones want&#010;are&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; typically&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;related around your thoughts/feelings around the product rather&#010;&gt; than&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; which&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;particular animal you prefer, which is a bit of a secondary&#010;kind of&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; input&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;along with all different kinds of other constraints/ideas (the&#010;boss&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;prefers&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;blue).&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;When I first encountered maven I had come to the realization&#010;that&#010;&gt; &gt; all my&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;ant projects were basically the same, and that there was no&#010;reason&#010;&gt; &gt; for&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;customizing&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;what was basically a standard process. So maven gives me&#010;&gt; associations&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; to a&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;mass-production line at a factory, rather than a tailor making&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; individual&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;processes. Furthermore, the lifecycle amplifies the idea of&#010;a&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;conveyor-belt&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;mass-production line; all parts move through the same conveyor&#010;belt&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;process, stopping at&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;individual stages to get work done. I would almost be willing&#010;to&#010;&gt; &gt; think&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; of&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;a&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;waterfall (Uh-oh...)&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;So it would appear to me that I'm not thinking of an animal&#010;at all&#010;&gt; !&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;Kristian&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;2014/1/9 Mark H. Wood &lt;mwood@iupui.edu&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; On Thu, Jan 09, 2014 at 09:32:54AM -0600, Curtis Rueden&#010;wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt; All of the logos are OK, but none of them really&#010;symbolize&#010;&gt; &gt; anything&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; in&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt; particular about Maven. IMO the best logos encapsulate&#010;the&#010;&gt; &gt; purpose&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; of&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;the&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt; project somehow, either overtly, covertly or both.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; Good point.  I was associating with the name "Maven",&#010;looking&#010;&gt; for a&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; symbol of in-depth understanding of a specialized field.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/maven&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; So, what does Maven do?  It passes unique source and object&#010;code&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; inputs through a standardized process, guided by an expression&#010;of&#010;&gt; &gt; the&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; relationships among those inputs, to assemble a well-specified&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; configuration of runnable code.  What does that look like?&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; --&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; Mark H. Wood, Lead System Programmer   mwood@IUPUI.Edu&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; Machines should not be friendly.  Machines should be obedient.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; ---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; --&#010;&gt; &gt; Tim Pizey&#010;&gt; &gt; http://pizey.net/~timp&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; ---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;&gt; &gt; To unsubscribe, e-mail: dev-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; &gt; For additional commands, e-mail: dev-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;

Does the Apache Foundation of any of its members have any money to&#010;engage a graphical designer? I was just thinking that after the&#010;voting, you could get a designer to do a proper job on the logo&#010;(perhaps producing some variations of the voted on design which could&#010;again be voted on further?). I do not mean any offence to everyone&#010;that submitted designs, but clearly we are not professional artists&#010;;-)&#010;&#010;On 14 January 2014 12:40, Stephen Connolly&#010;&lt;stephen.alan.connolly@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt; We are "Apache Maven" so there is always going to be that temptation to&#010;&gt; abuse the "Apache" link...&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I would like to hear more about your objections.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Keep in mind that ultimately it will come down to a vote...&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I'm thinking we have two rounds of voting... the first round to select the&#010;&gt; top 3 and the second round to select the winner...&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; WIth the above scheme I would plan on having a healthy discussion of the&#010;&gt; top 3 candidates in case any are deemed inappropriate, i.e. the PMC will&#010;&gt; reserve the right to veto any that it deems inappropriate, substituting&#010;&gt; with the next most popular.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Then the winner will be an open vote from the 3 finalists...&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Or at least that is my plan&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; So far we have about 8 ideas...&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; * The moose with the internet in his hand&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; * The owl&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; * The assembly line&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; * The honey badger&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; * The two yurts in a native american style&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; * The twin peaks&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; * The fedora as an M (likely too close to redhat... so not counting for now)&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; * A simple lettering with a monochrome feather&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; * A stylized lettering with the feather as a y&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; If we get to about 15-20 ideas and/or there seems to be a stop to the flow&#010;&gt; of new ideas, then I will probably call the first round of voting...&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; So maven gives me associations&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; to a&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;mass-production line at a factory, rather than a tailor making&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; individual&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;processes. Wood &lt;mwood@iupui.edu&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; On Thu, Jan 09, 2014 at 09:32:54AM -0600, Curtis Rueden&#010;wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt; All of the logos are OK, but none of them really symbolize&#010;&gt;&gt; anything&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; in&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt; particular about Maven. IMO the best logos encapsulate&#010;the&#010;&gt;&gt; purpose&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; of&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;the&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt; project somehow, either overtly, covertly or both.&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; Good point.  I was associating with the name "Maven", looking&#010;for a&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; symbol of in-depth understanding of a specialized field.&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/maven&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; So, what does Maven do? I think we would have no issue getting a small amount of funding from the&#010;foundation to feed an external logo competition... but I think we would&#010;want to have some scope defined for such a competition... so yeah I see no&#010;issue with using the top 3 as seed for an external logo competition, e.g.&#010;on the site already mentioned on a previous thread... but I think we do&#010;need a spec and part of the point of this discussion is to generate such a&#010;spec.&#010;&#010;&#010;On 14 January 2014 12:45, Adam Retter &lt;adam.retter@googlemail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; Does the Apache Foundation of any of its members have any money to&#010;&gt; engage a graphical designer? I was just thinking that after the&#010;&gt; voting, you could get a designer to do a proper job on the logo&#010;&gt; (perhaps producing some variations of the voted on design which could&#010;&gt; again be voted on further?). I do not mean any offence to everyone&#010;&gt; that submitted designs, but clearly we are not professional artists&#010;&gt; ;-)&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; On 14 January 2014 12:40, Stephen Connolly&#010;&gt; &lt;stephen.alan.connolly@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt; We are "Apache Maven" so there is always going to be that temptation to&#010;&gt; &gt; abuse the "Apache" link...&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; I would like to hear more about your objections.&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; Keep in mind that ultimately it will come down to a vote...&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; I'm thinking we have two rounds of voting... the first round to select&#010;&gt; the&#010;&gt; &gt; top 3 and the second round to select the winner...&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; WIth the above scheme I would plan on having a healthy discussion of the&#010;&gt; &gt; top 3 candidates in case any are deemed inappropriate, i.e. the PMC will&#010;&gt; &gt; reserve the right to veto any that it deems inappropriate, substituting&#010;&gt; &gt; with the next most popular.&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; Then the winner will be an open vote from the 3 finalists...&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; Or at least that is my plan&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; So far we have about 8 ideas...&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; * The moose with the internet in his hand&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; * The owl&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; * The assembly line&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; * The honey badger&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; * The two yurts in a native american style&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; * The twin peaks&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; * The fedora as an M (likely too close to redhat... so not counting for&#010;&gt; now)&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; * A simple lettering with a monochrome feather&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; * A stylized lettering with the feather as a y&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; If we get to about 15-20 ideas and/or there seems to be a stop to the&#010;&gt; flow&#010;&gt; &gt; of new ideas, then I will probably call the first round of voting...&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; On 14 January 2014 12:19, Tim Pizey &lt;timp@paneris.org&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; That looks really nice (though I do have problems with any North&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; American Indian references).&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; cheers&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; TimP&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; On 14 January 2014 12:08, Stephen Connolly&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &lt;stephen.alan.connolly@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt; Putting maven-20 in context, you get:&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; http://people.apache.org/~stephenc/maven-logo-contest/maven-20-in-context.png&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt; On 14 January 2014 10:37, Stephen Connolly&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt; &lt;stephen.alan.connolly@gmail.com&gt;wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; My wife had a suggestion... why not make the M in maven out of two&#010;&gt; tee&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; pees... linking in with the Apache theme...&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; So I present&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; maven-19:&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/download/attachments/38569278/maven-19.png?version=1&amp;modificationDate=1389695638903&amp;api=v2&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; and finding a use for the feather&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; maven-20:&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/download/attachments/38569278/maven-20.png?version=1&amp;modificationDate=1389695654233&amp;api=v2&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; On 14 January 2014 10:35, Stephen Connolly &lt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; stephen.alan.connolly@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; As a homage to Roy's wife, may I present&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; maven-18:&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/download/attachments/38569278/maven-18.png?version=1&amp;modificationDate=1389695623134&amp;api=v2&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; On 13 January 2014 15:36, Lyons, Roy &lt;Roy.Lyons@cmegroup.com&gt;&#010;&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; I asked my wife on the drive to the train today what animal&#010;she&#010;&gt; thinks&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; fits Maven.  Her response made me chuckle.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Without hesitation, she said "Honey Badger"&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; When I asked why, she said that Honey Badgers are part of nature&#010;&gt; and&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; generally do their thing nicely -- but if you piss it off,&#010;things&#010;&gt; will&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; get&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; really really bad...  She said she had the same experience&#010;with&#010;&gt; Maven.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;  It&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; works nicely, but if you try to do something really non-standard,&#010;&gt; you&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; will&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; feel its wrath :)&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Heh.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Anyhow, I thought it was funny enough to share - not really&#010;a&#010;&gt; serious&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; consideration to make a Honey Badger our mascot.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; On 1/10/14 1:20 AM, "Kristian Rosenvold" &lt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; kristian.rosenvold@gmail.com&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;I think the association-work around what maven /is/ is&#010;a great&#010;&gt; way to&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;approach a logo contest elsewhere. I have worked with some&#010;great&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; graphic&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;designers in my time, and the kind input the good ones&#010;want are&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; typically&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;related around your thoughts/feelings around the product&#010;rather&#010;&gt; than&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; which&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;particular animal you prefer, which is a bit of a secondary&#010;kind&#010;&gt; of&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; input&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;along with all different kinds of other constraints/ideas&#010;(the&#010;&gt; boss&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;prefers&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;blue).&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;When I first encountered maven I had come to the realization&#010;that&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; all my&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;ant projects were basically the same, and that there was&#010;no reason&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; for&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;customizing&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;what was basically a standard process. So maven gives me&#010;&gt; associations&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; to a&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;mass-production line at a factory, rather than a tailor&#010;making&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; individual&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;processes. Furthermore, the lifecycle amplifies the idea&#010;of a&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;conveyor-belt&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;mass-production line; all parts move through the same conveyor&#010;&gt; belt&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;process, stopping at&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;individual stages to get work done. I would almost be willing&#010;to&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; think&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; of&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;a&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;waterfall (Uh-oh...)&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;So it would appear to me that I'm not thinking of an animal&#010;at&#010;&gt; all !&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;Kristian&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;2014/1/9 Mark H. Wood &lt;mwood@iupui.edu&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; On Thu, Jan 09, 2014 at 09:32:54AM -0600, Curtis Rueden&#010;wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt; All of the logos are OK, but none of them really&#010;symbolize&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; anything&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; in&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt; particular about Maven. IMO the best logos encapsulate&#010;the&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; purpose&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; of&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;the&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt; project somehow, either overtly, covertly or&#010;both.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; Good point.  I was associating with the name "Maven",&#010;looking&#010;&gt; for a&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; symbol of in-depth understanding of a specialized&#010;field.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/maven&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; So, what does Maven do?  It passes unique source and&#010;object code&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; inputs through a standardized process, guided by an&#010;expression&#010;&gt; of&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; the&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; relationships among those inputs, to assemble a well-specified&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; configuration of runnable code.  What does that look&#010;like?&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; --&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; Mark H. Wood, Lead System Programmer   mwood@IUPUI.Edu&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; Machines should not be friendly.  Machines should&#010;be obedient.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; ---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; --&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; Tim Pizey&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; http://pizey.net/~timp&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; ---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; To unsubscribe, e-mail: dev-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; For additional commands, e-mail: dev-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; --&#010;&gt; Adam Retter&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; skype: adam.retter&#010;&gt; tweet: adamretter&#010;&gt; http://www.adamretter.org.uk&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; ---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;&gt; To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;

&quot;Mark H. Wood&quot; &lt;mw...@IUPUI.Edu&gt;  
Subject  :-
Re: New logo?  
Date  :-
Tue, 14 Jan 2014 15:51:12 GMT  
contents:- 
On Tue, Jan 14, 2014 at 12:08:09PM +0000, Stephen Connolly wrote:&#010;&gt; Putting maven-20 in context, you get:&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; http://people.apache.org/~stephenc/maven-logo-contest/maven-20-in-context.png&#010;&#010;*Very* nice work, but...what does this Native Americans theme have to do&#010;with "maven"?  Yes, I know, but people *will* ask.  Especially since&#010;the answer has no connection with what Maven would do for them.&#010;&#010;Unless I'm mistaken, the Maven landing page exists to sell Maven, not&#010;the Apache Software Foundation.  A link to the Foundation's landing&#010;page is quite appropriate and should be easy to find, but that's not&#010;why people come to this page.  They come because they've heard&#010;something about Maven and want to know more, or Google gave them a&#010;link when they asked something about software project management or&#010;build tools, or because some other project had a "built with Maven"&#010;link on its page and they're curious.  They'll probably be best&#010;pleased if, at a glance, they can get some notion of what Maven does.&#010;&#010;Possibly that message simply isn't very visual, and the best one can&#010;do is to select a (formerly) meaningless but unique mascot or abstract&#010;symbol.  Possibly there is an image that will make people think, "yes!&#010;that is Maven in action."&#010;&#010;I'm really not that sort of visual thinker, but images of structure,&#010;assembly, or gathering seem appropriate.  The best(?) I've been able&#010;to imagine is a funnel with classes falling in and a package falling&#010;out.  Or perhaps an assembly line.  (What do classes look like? beats&#010;me.)  Maybe you can do something with the Reactor:  skinny pipes bring&#010;things in, one big pipe lets the product out.&#010;&#010;-- &#010;Mark H. Wood, Lead System Programmer   mwood@IUPUI.Edu&#010;Machines should not be friendly.  Machines should be obedient.&#010;&#010;

Love this logo. Very awesome.&#010;&#010;&#010;On Tue, Jan 14, 2014 at 9:51 AM, Mark H. Wood &lt;mwood@iupui.edu&gt; wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; On Tue, Jan 14, 2014 at 12:08:09PM +0000, Stephen Connolly wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt; Putting maven-20 in context, you get:&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; http://people.apache.org/~stephenc/maven-logo-contest/maven-20-in-context.png&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; *Very* nice work, but...what does this Native Americans theme have to do&#010;&gt; with "maven"?  Yes, I know, but people *will* ask.  Especially since&#010;&gt; the answer has no connection with what Maven would do for them.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Unless I'm mistaken, the Maven landing page exists to sell Maven, not&#010;&gt; the Apache Software Foundation.  A link to the Foundation's landing&#010;&gt; page is quite appropriate and should be easy to find, but that's not&#010;&gt; why people come to this page.  They come because they've heard&#010;&gt; something about Maven and want to know more, or Google gave them a&#010;&gt; link when they asked something about software project management or&#010;&gt; build tools, or because some other project had a "built with Maven"&#010;&gt; link on its page and they're curious.  They'll probably be best&#010;&gt; pleased if, at a glance, they can get some notion of what Maven does.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Possibly that message simply isn't very visual, and the best one can&#010;&gt; do is to select a (formerly) meaningless but unique mascot or abstract&#010;&gt; symbol.  Possibly there is an image that will make people think, "yes!&#010;&gt; that is Maven in action."&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I'm really not that sort of visual thinker, but images of structure,&#010;&gt; assembly, or gathering seem appropriate.  The best(?) I've been able&#010;&gt; to imagine is a funnel with classes falling in and a package falling&#010;&gt; out.  Or perhaps an assembly line.  (What do classes look like? beats&#010;&gt; me.)  Maybe you can do something with the Reactor:  skinny pipes bring&#010;&gt; things in, one big pipe lets the product out.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; --&#010;&gt; Mark H. Wood, Lead System Programmer   mwood@IUPUI.Edu&#010;&gt; Machines should not be friendly.  Machines should be obedient.&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;-- &#010;Cheers,&#010;Paul&#010;&#010;

maven-22: uses some of the imagery from the 60-seconds tutorial to form the&#010;logo&#010;&#010;https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/download/attachments/38569278/maven-22.png?version=1&amp;modificationDate=1389716094692&amp;api=v2&#010;&#010;&#010;On 14 January 2014 15:55, Stephen Connolly&#010;&lt;stephen.alan.connolly@gmail.com&gt;wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; On 14 January 2014 15:51, Mark H. Wood &lt;mwood@iupui.edu&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; On Tue, Jan 14, 2014 at 12:08:09PM +0000, Stephen Connolly wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; Putting maven-20 in context, you get:&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; http://people.apache.org/~stephenc/maven-logo-contest/maven-20-in-context.png&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; *Very* nice work, but...what does this Native Americans theme have to do&#010;&gt;&gt; with "maven"?  Yes, I know, but people *will* ask.  Especially since&#010;&gt;&gt; the answer has no connection with what Maven would do for them.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Unless I'm mistaken, the Maven landing page exists to sell Maven, not&#010;&gt;&gt; the Apache Software Foundation.  A link to the Foundation's landing&#010;&gt;&gt; page is quite appropriate and should be easy to find, but that's not&#010;&gt;&gt; why people come to this page.  They come because they've heard&#010;&gt;&gt; something about Maven and want to know more, or Google gave them a&#010;&gt;&gt; link when they asked something about software project management or&#010;&gt;&gt; build tools, or because some other project had a "built with Maven"&#010;&gt;&gt; link on its page and they're curious.  They'll probably be best&#010;&gt;&gt; pleased if, at a glance, they can get some notion of what Maven does.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Possibly that message simply isn't very visual, and the best one can&#010;&gt;&gt; do is to select a (formerly) meaningless but unique mascot or abstract&#010;&gt;&gt; symbol.  Possibly there is an image that will make people think, "yes!&#010;&gt;&gt; that is Maven in action."&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; The best I have come up with for an image as to what Maven does is&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/Tutorial%3A+Maven+in+60+seconds&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; But that does not a good logo make.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Our current "logo" is just the word "maven" with the 'a' in orange&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; At least this version, or maven-21 includes the Apache feather... and&#010;&gt; hints at us being an Apache project...&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; I'm really not that sort of visual thinker, but images of structure,&#010;&gt;&gt; assembly, or gathering seem appropriate.  The best(?) I've been able&#010;&gt;&gt; to imagine is a funnel with classes falling in and a package falling&#010;&gt;&gt; out.  Or perhaps an assembly line.  (What do classes look like? beats&#010;&gt;&gt; me.)  Maybe you can do something with the Reactor:  skinny pipes bring&#010;&gt;&gt; things in, one big pipe lets the product out.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; --&#010;&gt;&gt; Mark H. Wood, Lead System Programmer   mwood@IUPUI.Edu&#010;&gt;&gt; Machines should not be friendly.  Machines should be obedient.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- 
Stephen Connolly &lt;stephen.alan.conno...@gmail.com&gt;  
Subject  :-
Re: New logo?  
Date  :-
Tue, 14 Jan 2014 16:30:45 GMT  
contents:- 
Maven is like a village made from tents... you can move from location to&#010;location (project to project) and you bring all the same tents (phases /&#010;conventions as to how to build a project) with you. Because we are an&#010;Apache project we chose a tent that is keeping with the stylings of the&#010;Apache feather logo&#010;&#010;There's a post-hoc justification for you ;-)&#010;&#010;&#010;On 14 January 2014 15:51, Mark H. Wood &lt;mwood@iupui.edu&gt; wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; On Tue, Jan 14, 2014 at 12:08:09PM +0000, Stephen Connolly wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt; Putting maven-20 in context, you get:&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; http://people.apache.org/~stephenc/maven-logo-contest/maven-20-in-context.png&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; *Very* nice work, but...what does this Native Americans theme have to do&#010;&gt; with "maven"?  Yes, I know, but people *will* ask.  Especially since&#010;&gt; the answer has no connection with what Maven would do for them.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Unless I'm mistaken, the Maven landing page exists to sell Maven, not&#010;&gt; the Apache Software Foundation.  A link to the Foundation's landing&#010;&gt; page is quite appropriate and should be easy to find, but that's not&#010;&gt; why people come to this page.  They come because they've heard&#010;&gt; something about Maven and want to know more, or Google gave them a&#010;&gt; link when they asked something about software project management or&#010;&gt; build tools, or because some other project had a "built with Maven"&#010;&gt; link on its page and they're curious.  They'll probably be best&#010;&gt; pleased if, at a glance, they can get some notion of what Maven does.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Possibly that message simply isn't very visual, and the best one can&#010;&gt; do is to select a (formerly) meaningless but unique mascot or abstract&#010;&gt; symbol.  Possibly there is an image that will make people think, "yes!&#010;&gt; that is Maven in action."&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I'm really not that sort of visual thinker, but images of structure,&#010;&gt; assembly, or gathering seem appropriate.  The best(?) I've been able&#010;&gt; to imagine is a funnel with classes falling in and a package falling&#010;&gt; out.  Or perhaps an assembly line.  (What do classes look like? beats&#010;&gt; me.)  Maybe you can do something with the Reactor:  skinny pipes bring&#010;&gt; things in, one big pipe lets the product out.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; --&#010;&gt; Mark H. Wood, Lead System Programmer   mwood@IUPUI.Edu&#010;&gt; Machines should not be friendly.  Machines should be obedient.&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;

And if you are not a nomadic developer (who jumps from project to project)&#010;then a lot of the benefits of Maven will seem to get in your way... once&#010;you are moving from project to project, knowing that you always have the&#010;`deploy` tent to push the results of your build to the remote repository is&#010;a "good thing™"&#010;&#010;&#010;On 14 January 2014 16:30, Stephen Connolly&#010;&lt;stephen.alan.connolly@gmail.com&gt;wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; Maven is like a village made from tents... you can move from location to&#010;&gt; location (project to project) and you bring all the same tents (phases /&#010;&gt; conventions as to how to build a project) with you. Name  :- 
onlypq &lt;onl...@gmail.com&gt;  
Subject  :-
Re: Adding the path to the pom file as a variable.  
Date  :-
Thu, 02 Jan 2014 19:14:36 GMT  
contents:- 
Thanks Wayne...&#010;&#010;In Teamcity I am trying to use maven to run Sonar to analyze a projects.&#010;When the projects build I need to execute Sonar in that directory, which the&#010;directories are created using a revision number so they will always be&#010;different. &#010;&#010;When the project builds it creates a text file (POMlastbuild3.0.txt) which&#010;has the build dir path. I then check out  my pom file into that dir... &#010;below is the command line script I run from TeamCity&#010;&#010;POMPATH=` cat /home/pomfiles/POMlastbuild3.0.txt`&#010;export POMPATH&#010;&#010;svn co https://atl-wdsvn1.abctm.org/svn/Pom/CDM $POMPATH&#010;&#010;export&#010;PATH=/home/teamcity/maven-3.0.3/apache-maven-3.0.3/bin:/usr/kerberos/sbin:/usr/kerberos/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin&#010;export M2_HOME=/home/teamcity/apache-maven-3.0.5&#010;export PATH=/usr/java/jdk1.6.0_21/bin:$PATH&#010;export JAVA_HOME=/usr/java/jdk1.6.0_21&#010;&#010;mvn sonar:sonar -Dsonar.host.url=http://12.219.180.137:9000&#010;-Dsonar.jdbc.url=jdbc:postgresql://12.219.180.137/sonar&#010;-Dsonar.jdbc.username=sonar -Dsonar.jdbc.password=sonar1dev&#010;-Dmaven.test.failure.ignore=true&#010;&#010;But when maven runs it looks for the pom in a directory Teamcity created. &#010;&#010;Do not know if i am doing this correctly, but I think all I need to do is&#010;use $POMPATH in the maven command so it can find the pom.&#010;&#010;Thank you for your help&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;--&#010;View this message in context: http://maven.40175.n5.nabble.com/Adding-the-path-to-the-pom-file-as-a-variable-tp5779909p5779945.html&#010;Sent from the Maven - Users mailing list archive at Nabble.com.&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- 
Ziga GREGORIC &lt;ziga.grego...@gmail.com&gt;  
Subject  :-
Re: Adding the path to the pom file as a variable.  
Date  :-
Thu, 02 Jan 2014 19:37:20 GMT  
contents:- 
I have to agree with Wayne here - this setup is not easy to understand.&#010;Since my setup consists of TeamCity and SonarSource, here are my 2 cents.&#010;&#010;Is this a maven project?&#010;Can it be build simply with 'mvn clean install'?&#010;&#010;If both answers are yes, than have a:&#010;- build configuration in TeamCity that builds it using project's pom.xml&#010;using goal 'mvn clean install' and&#010;- another build configuration that has a goal 'sonar:sonar' and you're&#010;done.&#010;Leave the checkout directory as default and make sure you use the same&#010;build agent to run both build configurations.&#010;All sonar specific environment settings can be moved to settings.xml of the&#010;build agent.&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;On Thu, Jan 2, 2014 at 8:14 PM, onlypq &lt;onlypq@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; Thanks Wayne...&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; In Teamcity I am trying to use maven to run Sonar to analyze a projects.&#010;&gt; When the projects build I need to execute Sonar in that directory, which&#010;&gt; the&#010;&gt; directories are created using a revision number so they will always be&#010;&gt; different.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; When the project builds it creates a text file (POMlastbuild3.0.txt) which&#010;&gt; has the build dir path. I then check out  my pom file into that dir...&#010;&gt; below is the command line script I run from TeamCity&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; POMPATH=` cat /home/pomfiles/POMlastbuild3.0.txt`&#010;&gt; export POMPATH&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; svn co https://atl-wdsvn1.abctm.org/svn/Pom/CDM $POMPATH&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; export&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; PATH=/home/teamcity/maven-3.0.3/apache-maven-3.0.3/bin:/usr/kerberos/sbin:/usr/kerberos/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin&#010;&gt; export M2_HOME=/home/teamcity/apache-maven-3.0.5&#010;&gt; export PATH=/usr/java/jdk1.6.0_21/bin:$PATH&#010;&gt; export JAVA_HOME=/usr/java/jdk1.6.0_21&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; mvn sonar:sonar -Dsonar.host.url=http://12.219.180.137:9000&#010;&gt; -Dsonar.jdbc.url=jdbc:postgresql://12.219.180.137/sonar&#010;&gt; -Dsonar.jdbc.username=sonar -Dsonar.jdbc.password=sonar1dev&#010;&gt; -Dmaven.test.failure.ignore=true&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; But when maven runs it looks for the pom in a directory Teamcity created.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Do not know if i am doing this correctly, but I think all I need to do is&#010;&gt; use $POMPATH in the maven command so it can find the pom.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Thank you for your help&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; --&#010;&gt; View this message in context:&#010;&gt; http://maven.40175.n5.nabble.com/Adding-the-path-to-the-pom-file-as-a-variable-tp5779909p5779945.html&#010;&gt; Sent from the Maven - Users mailing list archive at Nabble.com.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; ---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;&gt; To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- 
Jim Garrison &lt;jim.garri...@nwea.org&gt;  
Subject  :-
assembly plugin jar-with-dependencies - how to refer to artifact name later?  
Date  :-
Thu, 02 Jan 2014 20:05:26 GMT  
contents:- 
I build a jar-with-dependencies in one execution of the assembly plugin.&#010;&#010;In a second execution I use the assembly plugin to package a distributable zip, and need to&#010;substitute the name of the jar-with-dependencies output artifact into a script file that launches&#010;the program.  &#010;&#010;Does the assembly plugin put the output artifact name into the environment so it can be substituted&#010;later? If so, what is the variable name? If not, is there another way to accomplish this?&#010;&#010;Assembly plugin configuration:&#010;&#010;      &lt;plugin&gt;&#010;        &lt;artifactId&gt;maven-assembly-plugin&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;        &lt;version&gt;2.4&lt;/version&gt;&#010;        &lt;executions&gt;&#010;          &lt;execution&gt;&#010;            &lt;id&gt;make-jwd&lt;/id&gt; &lt;!-- this is used for inheritance merges --&gt;&#010;            &lt;phase&gt;package&lt;/phase&gt; &lt;!-- bind to the packaging phase --&gt;&#010;            &lt;configuration&gt;&#010;              &lt;descriptorRefs&gt;&#010;                &lt;descriptorRef&gt;jar-with-dependencies&lt;/descriptorRef&gt;&#010;              &lt;/descriptorRefs&gt;&#010;              &lt;archive&gt;&#010;                &lt;manifest&gt;&#010;                  &lt;mainClass&gt;org.nwea.jhg.dbextract.Driver&lt;/mainClass&gt;&#010;                &lt;/manifest&gt;&#010;              &lt;/archive&gt;&#010;            &lt;/configuration&gt;&#010;            &lt;goals&gt;&#010;              &lt;goal&gt;single&lt;/goal&gt;&#010;            &lt;/goals&gt;&#010;          &lt;/execution&gt;&#010;          &lt;execution&gt;&#010;            &lt;id&gt;make-zip&lt;/id&gt; &lt;!-- this is used for inheritance merges --&gt;&#010;            &lt;phase&gt;package&lt;/phase&gt; &lt;!-- bind to the packaging phase --&gt;&#010;            &lt;configuration&gt;&#010;              &lt;descriptors&gt;&#010;                &lt;descriptor&gt;src/main/assembly/zip.xml&lt;/descriptor&gt;&#010;              &lt;/descriptors&gt;&#010;            &lt;/configuration&gt;&#010;            &lt;goals&gt;&#010;              &lt;goal&gt;single&lt;/goal&gt;&#010;            &lt;/goals&gt;&#010;          &lt;/execution&gt;&#010;        &lt;/executions&gt;&#010;      &lt;/plugin&gt;&#010;&#010;Assembly descriptor:&#010;&#010;&lt;assembly xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-assembly-plugin/assembly/1.1.2"&#010;xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"&#010;  xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-assembly-plugin/assembly/1.1.2&#010;http://maven.apache.org/xsd/assembly-1.1.2.xsd"&gt;&#010;  &lt;id&gt;zip&lt;/id&gt;&#010;  &lt;formats&gt;&#010;    &lt;format&gt;zip&lt;/format&gt;&#010;  &lt;/formats&gt;&#010;  &lt;fileSets&gt;&#010;    &lt;fileSet&gt;&#010;      &lt;directory&gt;${project.basedir}/src/main/scripts&lt;/directory&gt;&#010;      &lt;outputDirectory&gt;/&lt;/outputDirectory&gt;&#010;      &lt;filtered&gt;true&lt;/filtered&gt;&#010;    &lt;/fileSet&gt;&#010;    &lt;fileSet&gt;&#010;      &lt;directory&gt;${project.basedir}/config&lt;/directory&gt;&#010;      &lt;outputDirectory&gt;/&lt;/outputDirectory&gt;&#010;    &lt;/fileSet&gt;&#010;    &lt;fileSet&gt;&#010;      &lt;directory&gt;${project.build.directory}&lt;/directory&gt;&#010;      &lt;outputDirectory&gt;/&lt;/outputDirectory&gt;&#010;      &lt;includes&gt;&#010;        &lt;include&gt;*-jar-with-dependencies.jar&lt;/include&gt;&#010;      &lt;/includes&gt;&#010;    &lt;/fileSet&gt;&#010;  &lt;/fileSets&gt;&#010;&lt;/assembly&gt;&#010;&#010;File into which I wish to substitute the name of the jar-with-dependencies artifact:&#010;&#010;#!/bin/bash&#010;export DBEX_CMD=dbex&#010;java -jar ${what-do-i-put-here} $*&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

             &lt;/goals&gt;&#010;&gt;            &lt;/execution&gt;&#010;&gt;            &lt;execution&gt;&#010;&gt;              &lt;id&gt;make-zip&lt;/id&gt; &lt;!-- this is used for inheritance merges&#010;--&gt;&#010;&gt;                &lt;/descriptors&gt;&#010;&gt;              &lt;/configuration&gt;&#010;&gt;              &lt;goals&gt;&#010;&gt;                &lt;goal&gt;single&lt;/goal&gt;&#010;&gt;              &lt;/goals&gt;&#010;&gt;            &lt;/execution&gt;&#010;&gt;          &lt;/executions&gt;&#010;&gt;        &lt;/plugin&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Assembly descriptor:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; &lt;assembly xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-assembly-plugin/assembly/1.1.2"&#010;xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"&#010;&gt;    xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-assembly-plugin/assembly/1.1.2&#010;http://maven.apache.org/xsd/assembly-1.1.2.xsd"&gt;&#010;&gt;    &lt;id&gt;zip&lt;/id&gt;&#010;&gt;    &lt;formats&gt;&#010;&gt;      &lt;format&gt;zip&lt;/format&gt;&#010;&gt;    &lt;/formats&gt;&#010;&gt;    &lt;fileSets&gt;&#010;&gt;      &lt;fileSet&gt;&#010;&gt;        &lt;directory&gt;${project.basedir}/src/main/scripts&lt;/directory&gt;&#010;&gt;        &lt;outputDirectory&gt;/&lt;/outputDirectory&gt;&#010;&gt;        &lt;filtered&gt;true&lt;/filtered&gt;&#010;&gt;      &lt;/fileSet&gt;&#010;&gt;      &lt;fileSet&gt;&#010;&gt;        &lt;directory&gt;${project.basedir}/config&lt;/directory&gt;&#010;&gt;        &lt;outputDirectory&gt;/&lt;/outputDirectory&gt;&#010;&gt;      &lt;/fileSet&gt;&#010;&gt;      &lt;fileSet&gt;&#010;&gt;        &lt;directory&gt;${project.build.directory}&lt;/directory&gt;&#010;&gt;        &lt;outputDirectory&gt;/&lt;/outputDirectory&gt;&#010;&gt;        &lt;includes&gt;&#010;&gt;          &lt;include&gt;*-jar-with-dependencies.jar&lt;/include&gt;&#010;&gt;        &lt;/includes&gt;&#010;&gt;      &lt;/fileSet&gt;&#010;&gt;    &lt;/fileSets&gt;&#010;&gt; &lt;/assembly&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; File into which I wish to substitute the name of the jar-with-dependencies artifact:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                  &lt;descriptor&gt;src/main/assembly/zip.xml&lt;/descriptor&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                &lt;/descriptors&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;              &lt;/configuration&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;              &lt;goals&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                &lt;goal&gt;single&lt;/goal&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;              &lt;/goals&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;            &lt;/execution&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;          &lt;/executions&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;        &lt;/plugin&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; Assembly descriptor:&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &lt;assembly xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-assembly-&#010;&gt; plugin/assembly/1.1.2" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-&#010;&gt; instance"&#010;&gt; &gt;    xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-&#010;&gt; assembly-plugin/assembly/1.1.2 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/assembly-&#010;&gt; 1.1.2.xsd"&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;    &lt;id&gt;zip&lt;/id&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;    &lt;formats&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;      &lt;format&gt;zip&lt;/format&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;    &lt;/formats&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;    &lt;fileSets&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;      &lt;fileSet&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;        &lt;directory&gt;${project.basedir}/src/main/scripts&lt;/directory&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;        &lt;outputDirectory&gt;/&lt;/outputDirectory&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;        &lt;filtered&gt;true&lt;/filtered&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;      &lt;/fileSet&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;      &lt;fileSet&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;        &lt;directory&gt;${project.basedir}/config&lt;/directory&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;        &lt;outputDirectory&gt;/&lt;/outputDirectory&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;      &lt;/fileSet&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;      &lt;fileSet&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;        &lt;directory&gt;${project.build.directory}&lt;/directory&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;        &lt;outputDirectory&gt;/&lt;/outputDirectory&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;        &lt;includes&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;          &lt;include&gt;*-jar-with-dependencies.jar&lt;/include&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;        &lt;/includes&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;      &lt;/fileSet&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;    &lt;/fileSets&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &lt;/assembly&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; File into which I wish to substitute the name of the jar-with-dependencies&#010;&gt; artifact:&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; #!/bin/bash&#010;&gt; &gt; export DBEX_CMD=dbex&#010;&gt; &gt; java -jar ${what-do-i-put-here} $*&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; ---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;&gt; &gt; To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; &gt; For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&#010;I think I figured out how to do this. I just used&#010;&#010;     ${project.build.finalName}-jar-with-dependencies.jar&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- 
Benson Margulies &lt;bimargul...@apache.org&gt;  
Subject  :-
[ANN] Maven Wagon 2.6 Released  
Date  :-
Thu, 02 Jan 2014 22:07:44 GMT  
contents:- 
The Apache Maven team is pleased to announce the release of the Apache&#010;Maven Wagon, version 2.6.&#010;&#010;The Wagon component provides communications between Maven and repositories.&#010;&#010;Typically, to use a particular version of Wagon, you would add an&#010;'extension' to your POM, such as:&#010;&#010;        &lt;extensions&gt;&#010;            &lt;extension&gt;&#010;                &lt;groupId&gt;org.apache.maven.wagon&lt;/groupId&gt;&#010;                &lt;artifactId&gt;wagon-ssh&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;                &lt;version&gt;2.6&lt;/version&gt;&#010;            &lt;/extension&gt;&#010;        &lt;/extensions&gt;&#010;&#010;Here are the issues addressed in version 2.6:&#010;&#010;** Improvement&#010;    * [WAGON-401] - Access Denied due to missing User-Agent&#010;    * [WAGON-402] - Upgrade Apache HttpClient based wagon provider to&#010;HttpClient 4.3&#010;    * [WAGON-403] - SSH agent support for wagon-ssh&#010;&#010;&#010;Enjoy,&#010;&#010;-The Apache Maven team&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Maven Plugin Logging  
Date  :-
Fri, 03 Jan 2014 09:44:06 GMT  
contents:- 
Hi All,&#010;&#010;I implemented my own Maven plugin mojo in which I used log4j + slf4j. In&#010;the plugin project I have included the correct jars and can see correct&#010;logging of statements from code.&#010;&#010;Now I want use this new maven plugin in another client project but having&#010;trouble getting it to work correctly.&#010;&#010;In the plugin itself I have included a log4j.properties under&#010;src/main/resources which works fine as mentioned above. But when I try to&#010;include the plugin in another client project the log file is not being&#010;created.&#010;&#010;The question is what else do I have to try or do to get this working&#010;correctly?&#010;&#010;Thank you.&#010;Omar&#010;&#010;

Name  :- 
Cleuton Sampaio &lt;cleuton.samp...@gmail.com&gt;  
Subject  :-
Re: Maven Plugin Logging  
Date  :-
Fri, 03 Jan 2014 16:02:12 GMT  
contents:- 
Did you based your mojo on class AbstractMojo ?  If you did, then you should use the getLog()&#010;method. See:&#010;&#010;http://maven.apache.org/ref/2.2.1/maven-plugin-api/apidocs/org/apache/maven/plugin/AbstractMojo.html&#010;&#010;Cleuton Sampaio&#010;&#010;&gt; Em 03/01/2014, às 07:44, "Omar@Gmail" &lt;omarnetbox@googlemail.com&gt; escreveu:&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Hi All,&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; I implemented my own Maven plugin mojo in which I used log4j + slf4j. In&#010;&gt; the plugin project I have included the correct jars and can see correct&#010;&gt; logging of statements from code.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Now I want use this new maven plugin in another client project but having&#010;&gt; trouble getting it to work correctly.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; In the plugin itself I have included a log4j.properties under&#010;&gt; src/main/resources which works fine as mentioned above. But when I try to&#010;&gt; include the plugin in another client project the log file is not being&#010;&gt; created.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; The question is what else do I have to try or do to get this working&#010;&gt; correctly?&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Thank you.&#010;&gt; Omar&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- 
Cleuton Sampaio &lt;cleuton.samp...@gmail.com&gt;  
Subject  :-
Re: Maven Plugin Logging  
Date  :-
Fri, 03 Jan 2014 23:15:11 GMT  
contents:- 
You should use the object returned by the getLog method, which is an implementation of &#010;&#010;org.apache.maven.plugin.logging &#010;Interface Log&#010;&#010;It is exactly the architecture that I am using in my own plugin: jQana (Github). It is still&#010;in early dev stage, but I am facing that same problem. The only way to solve is to use the&#010;Log implemantation returned by getLog. &#010;&#010;Here I am instantiating my pojo from the mojo, and passing the Log Object:&#010;&#010;                        DefaultProjectProcessor dpp = new DefaultProjectProcessor(new Context());&#010;                        dpp.setLog(getLog());&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;Here I am logging in my pojo:&#010;&#010;                         // using maven plugin logger&#010;                         switch (type) {&#010;                         case INFO:&#010;                                 this.log.info(msg);&#010;                                 break;&#010;                         case DEBUG:&#010;                                 this.log.debug(msg);&#010;                                 break;&#010;                         case ERROR:&#010;                                 this.log.error(msg);&#010;                         }&#010;&#010;&#010;Cleuton Sampaio&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;&gt; Em 03/01/2014, às 18:46, "Omar@Gmail" &lt;omarnetbox@googlemail.com&gt; escreveu:&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Thanks Cleuton, in my custom plugin which I developed I have a Mojo that&#010;&gt; extends AbstractMojo but this Mojo delegates to a Pojo. Both the Mojo and&#010;&gt; Pojo each have  their won logger. In this case does your suggestion still&#010;&gt; stand? can you suggest some simple steps to use the AbstractMojo getLog()&#010;&gt; method.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Omar&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt; On 3 January 2014 16:02, Cleuton Sampaio &lt;cleuton.sampaio@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt; Did you based your mojo on class AbstractMojo ?  If you did, then you&#010;&gt;&gt; should use the getLog() method. See:&#010;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt; http://maven.apache.org/ref/2.2.1/maven-plugin-api/apidocs/org/apache/maven/plugin/AbstractMojo.html&#010;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt; Cleuton Sampaio&#010;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Em 03/01/2014, às 07:44, "Omar@Gmail" &lt;omarnetbox@googlemail.com&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; escreveu:&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Hi All,&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; I implemented my own Maven plugin mojo in which I used log4j + slf4j. In&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; the plugin project I have included the correct jars and can see correct&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; logging of statements from code.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Now I want use this new maven plugin in another client project but having&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; trouble getting it to work correctly.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; In the plugin itself I have included a log4j.properties under&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; src/main/resources which works fine as mentioned above. But when I try to&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; include the plugin in another client project the log file is not being&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; created.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; The question is what else do I have to try or do to get this working&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; correctly?&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Thank you.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Omar&#010;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt; ---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;&gt;&gt; To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt;&gt; For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt; &#010;&#010;

The Maven team is pleased to announce the release of the Apache Maven Jarsigner,  &#010;version 1.3&#010;&#010;This component provides some utilities to sign/verify jars/files in your Mojos.&#010;&#010;http://maven.apache.org/shared/maven-jarsigner/&#010;&#010;To use the Maven Jarsigner, add the following dependency to your project:&#010;&#010;   &lt;dependency&gt;&#010;     &lt;groupId&gt;org.apache.maven.shared&lt;/groupId&gt;&#010;     &lt;artifactId&gt;maven-jarsigner&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;     &lt;version&gt;1.3&lt;/version&gt;&#010;   &lt;/dependency&gt;&#010;&#010;Release Notes - Maven Shared Components - Version maven-jarsigner-1.3&#010;&#010;** Bug&#010;    * [MSHARED-314] - Unsigning a jar is not correct&#010;&#010;Enjoy,&#010;&#010;-The Maven team&#010;&#010;tony.&#010;&#010;-- &#010;Tony Chemit&#010;--------------------&#010;tél: +33 (0) 2 40 50 29 28&#010;http://www.codelutin.com&#010;email: chemit@codelutin.com&#010;twitter: https://twitter.com/tchemit&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Tony Chemit &lt;tche...@apache.org&gt;  
Subject  :-
[ANN] Maven Jarsigner Plugin 1.3 Released  
Date  :-
Fri, 03 Jan 2014 10:48:42 GMT  
contents:- 
The Maven team is pleased to announce the release of the Maven Jarsigner&#010;Plugin, version 1.3.&#010;&#010;This plugin signs and verifies the project artifacts using the jarsigner&#010;tool. See the plugin's site for more details:&#010;&#010;    http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-jarsigner-plugin/&#010;&#010;This plugin is meant to supercede the existing jar:sign and&#010;jar:verify goals from the Maven Jar Plugin which will be deprecated&#010;in a future release.&#010;&#010;To use the updated plugin in your projects, you need to add the &#010;following snippet to the plugins or plugin management section of your POM:&#010;&#010;    &lt;plugin&gt;&#010;      &lt;groupId&gt;org.apache.maven.plugins&lt;/groupId&gt;&#010;      &lt;artifactId&gt;maven-jarsigner-plugin&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;      &lt;version&gt;1.3&lt;/version&gt;&#010;      &lt;executions&gt;&#010;        ...&#010;      &lt;/executions&gt;&#010;    &lt;/plugin&gt;&#010;&#010;Release Notes - Maven Jar Signer Plugin - Version 1.3&#010;&#010;** Bug&#010;    * [MJARSIGNER-13] - signing in multi-module project fails on windows&#010;    * [MJARSIGNER-21] - jars signed using Java 7 have "invalid SHA1 signature"&#010;    * [MJARSIGNER-26] - Jar Signer does not support protected authentication path&#010;    * [MJARSIGNER-29] - verbose parameter is not filled in jarsigner requests&#010;&#010;** Improvement&#010;    * [MJARSIGNER-28] - verify mojo can also use keystore and alias parameters&#010;&#010;** New Feature&#010;    * [MJARSIGNER-12] - It should be possible to save the keystore in one location for multi&#010;module projects&#010;    * [MJARSIGNER-16] - Add the option -tsa to the configuration&#010;    * [MJARSIGNER-18] - Support for Jar plugin's "errorWhenNotSigned" option&#010;    * [MJARSIGNER-24] - Use Password Encryption in pom.xml&#010;&#010;** Task&#010;    * [MJARSIGNER-9] - Add toolchain in JarSignMojo.java#getJDKCommandExe()&#010;    * [MJARSIGNER-22] - Add french translations&#010;    * [MJARSIGNER-25] - use maven-plugin-tools' java 5 annotations&#010;    * [MJARSIGNER-27] - Use maven-jarsigner 1.3&#010;    * [MJARSIGNER-31] - Update maven-shared-utils to 0.5&#010;    * [MJARSIGNER-32] - Update requirements to maven 2.1.0&#010;&#010;Enjoy,&#010;&#010;The Maven team.&#010;&#010;-- &#010;Tony Chemit&#010;--------------------&#010;tél: +33 (0) 2 40 50 29 28&#010;http://www.codelutin.com&#010;email: chemit@codelutin.com&#010;twitter: https://twitter.com/tchemit&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- 
&quot;Robert Scholte&quot; &lt;rfscho...@apache.org&gt;  
Subject  :-
Re: New site content  
Date  :-
Fri, 03 Jan 2014 15:17:54 GMT  
contents:- 
Hi,&#010;&#010;I like the idea of images, however I would avoid a graph to make something  &#010;clear for new Maven users.&#010;Instead I'd prefer a linear model.&#010;&#010;I think you should split the current model into pieces:&#010;&#010;A project model contains:&#010;- dependencies&#010;- a build plan&#010;- other project models ( you can call this the Droste effect[1] )&#010;- ...&#010;&#010;There are several build-plans, namely: a build-plan for jar, war, ear, etc.&#010;Every build plan has a set of predefined plugins,  which you can adjust  &#010;(with switches?)&#010;&#010;Now, what does Maven do?&#010;&#010;Maven reads the build plan and executes it. Some steps of the build plan  &#010;deliver products ( compiled classes, test results, a package)&#010;&#010;I think the reactor might be confusing at this level.&#010;&#010;my 2 cents,&#010;&#010;Robert&#010;&#010;[1] http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Droste_effect&#010;&#010;&#010;Op Fri, 03 Jan 2014 15:41:15 +0100 schreef Stephen Connolly  &#010;&lt;stephen.alan.connolly@gmail.com&gt;:&#010;&#010;&gt; Just in case it wasn't clear... I'm looking for comments and feedback&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; On 3 January 2014 14:35, Stephen Connolly&#010;&gt; &lt;stephen.alan.connolly@gmail.com&gt;wrote:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; OK, so to start working on new content I created some pages on the wiki:&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; The first page is a 60 seconds overview of Maven's build process&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/Tutorial:+Maven+in+60+seconds&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; I am using icons because I want to have subsequent pages give more  &#010;&gt;&gt; detail&#010;&gt;&gt; and use the iconography to enable people to see what is being discussed&#010;&gt;&gt; more easily&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;  

================

Name  :- 
Stephen Connolly &lt;stephen.alan.conno...@gmail.com&gt;  
Subject  :-
Re: New site content  
Date  :-
Fri, 03 Jan 2014 15:46:33 GMT  
contents:- 
On 3 January 2014 15:17, Robert Scholte &lt;rfscholte@apache.org&gt; wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; Hi,&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I like the idea of images, however I would avoid a graph to make something&#010;&gt; clear for new Maven users.&#010;&gt; Instead I'd prefer a linear model.&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;My first draft did not have the graph at the top... perhaps it would be&#010;better suited at the bottom ;-)&#010;&#010;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I think you should split the current model into pieces:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; A project model contains:&#010;&gt; - dependencies&#010;&gt; - a build plan&#010;&gt; - other project models ( you can call this the Droste effect[1] )&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;I like to think of the project model as not just the root pom.xml but all&#010;the pom.xml files, so there is only one project model, this should make&#010;understanding how -pl, -am and -amd switches have their effects&#010;&#010;&#010;&gt; - ...&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; There are several build-plans, namely: a build-plan for jar, war, ear, etc.&#010;&gt; Every build plan has a set of predefined plugins,  which you can adjust&#010;&gt; (with switches?)&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;No there is one and only one build plan. We would have to redefine build&#010;plan everywhere else to be able to use it like that. There is a lifecycle&#010;binding for each packaging&#010;&#010;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Now, what does Maven do?&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Maven reads the build plan and executes it. Some steps of the build plan&#010;&gt; deliver products ( compiled classes, test results, a package)&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I think the reactor might be confusing at this level.&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;I want the 60sec tutorial to be the grand overview, the next tutorial is a&#010;5 minute one on how a .jar file gets built&#010;&#010;Then you have a multi-module webapp tutorial at 10-15min&#010;&#010;I want to reference all the core concepts from the 60 second overview even&#010;if only briefly, that way people can come back to the short page and say&#010;"ahh yes that is where that fits in again"&#010;&#010;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; my 2 cents,&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Robert&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; [1] http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Droste_effect&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Op Fri, 03 Jan 2014 15:41:15 +0100 schreef Stephen Connolly &lt;&#010;&gt; stephen.alan.connolly@gmail.com&gt;:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;  Just in case it wasn't clear... I'm looking for comments and feedback&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; On 3 January 2014 14:35, Stephen Connolly&#010;&gt;&gt; &lt;stephen.alan.connolly@gmail.com&gt;wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;  OK, so to start working on new content I created some pages on the wiki:&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; The first page is a 60 seconds overview of Maven's build process&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Tutorial:+Maven+in+60+seconds&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; I am using icons because I want to have subsequent pages give more detail&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; and use the iconography to enable people to see what is being discussed&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; more easily&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&#010;

&quot;Robert Scholte&quot; &lt;rfscho...@apache.org&gt;

Re: New site content
